Package org.arl.fjage

Class RealTimePlatform

java.lang.Object
org.arl.fjage.Platform
org.arl.fjage.RealTimePlatform
All Implemented Interfaces:
TimestampProvider
public final class RealTimePlatform extends Platform
A platform that runs the agents in its containers in real-time. The notion of time in this platform is that of elapsed time in the real world, and hence this is a suitable platform for most applications.

Typical use of this platform is shown below: 

 import org.arl.fjage.*;

 Platform platform = new RealTimePlatform();
 Container container = new Container(platform);
 container.add("myAgent", new myAgent());         // add appropriate agents
 platform.start();

  • Method Details

    • currentTimeMillis

      public long currentTimeMillis()
      Description copied from class: Platform
      Gets the current platform time in milliseconds. For real-time platforms, this time is epoch time. For simulation platforms, this time is simulation time.
      Specified by:
      currentTimeMillis in interface TimestampProvider
      Specified by:
      currentTimeMillis in class Platform
      Returns:
      time in milliseconds.

    • nanoTime

      public long nanoTime()
      Description copied from class: Platform
      Gets the current platform time in nanoseconds. For real-time platforms, this time is epoch time. For simulation platforms, this time is simulation time. This time is nanosecond precision, but not necessarily nanosecond accuracy.
      Specified by:
      nanoTime in interface TimestampProvider
      Specified by:
      nanoTime in class Platform
      Returns:
      time in nanoseconds.

    • delay

      public void delay(long millis)
      Description copied from class: Platform
      Delays execution by a specified number of milliseconds of platform time.

      This method should not be called by an agent directly, as it may deadlock. An agent should use Agent.delay(long) instead.

      Specified by:
      delay in class Platform
      Parameters:
      millis - number of milliseconds to delay execution.
